learning_outcomes.description: Identify appropriate contexts for applying quantitative research methods in health.
Recognise the ubiquity of variation in health and understand how biostatistics quantifies uncertainty.
Explore health data graphically and numerically using appropriate statistical software.
Estimate population parameters using sample health data.
Perform statistical inference, interpret results individually and in group settings within the context of health, and collaboratively present integrated findings.

assessments.due_date:
Reflection 1 - 12/08/2025

Working Document - 26/08/2025

Final Report - 24/10/2025

Reflection 2 - 31/10/2025

*Group Presentation 22/10/2025 - 29/10/2025

*In-class group presentation in weeks (#12 and #13)
assessments.category: Paper/ Report/ Annotation, Participation/ Student contribution, Presentation, Project, Reflection, Role play/ Simulation
assessments.task_description:
The assessment is a project based learning with individual and group tasks. Assessment 2 is a progressive assessment spanning weeks 1 to 13 of the semester. Students are encouraged to complete each part as they progress through the Course. The main components of this assessment are:

  • Choose a dataset and join a group – See specific instructions on the Blackboard.
  • Apply statistical analyses techniques covered in the course to the dataset (Individual tasks + Peer discussions). Specific instructions will be released weekly via Blackboard.
  • Team commitment: attend in-class group meetings and reflect on your team activities. Specific instructions will be released closer to the due dates on the Blackboard.
  • You will submit your working document (work in progress) and a final report. Specific instructions will be released closer to the due dates on the Blackboard.
  • You will do an in-class group presentation. Specific instructions will be released closer to the due dates on the Blackboard.


Weighting (60%):

  • Team Commitment: Reflection 1 - 2%; Reflection 2 - 3%
  • Working Document - 10%
  • Final Report - 25%
  • Group Presentation - 20%

learning_activities.topic:
Exploring Health Data

Variables and Distributions; Summary Statistics and Graphs of individual health related variables


Learning outcomes: L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Exploring Health Data Variables and Distributions; Summary Statistics and Graphs of individual health related variables

learning_activities.topic:
Exploring Health Data Relationships

Using two-way tables, scatterplots, correlation, regression line for exploring health data


Learning outcomes: L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Exploring Health Data Relationships Using two-way tables, scatterplots, correlation, regression line for exploring health data

learning_activities.topic:
Producing Health Data

Explore study designs and types of studies in health to create relevant datasets for quantitative analysis.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Producing Health Data Explore study designs and types of studies in health to create relevant datasets for quantitative analysis.

learning_activities.topic:
Statistical Inference in Health

Apply statistical inference techniques to analyse health datasets, interpreting results to draw evidence-based conclusions in health research.

Learning outcomes: L01, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Statistical Inference in Health Apply statistical inference techniques to analyse health datasets, interpreting results to draw evidence-based conclusions in health research.

learning_activities.topic:
Inference in Practice for Health

Interpret confidence intervals and statistical significance tests in health studies, addressing cautions and determining sample size requirements for reliable health research outcomes.

Learning outcomes: L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Inference in Practice for Health Interpret confidence intervals and statistical significance tests in health studies, addressing cautions and determining sample size requirements for reliable health research outcomes.

learning_activities.topic:
Inference for Quantitative Variables in Health

Conduct one and two-sample t-tests and construct confidence intervals to analyse health data, such as comparing treatment effects or patient outcomes in clinical studies.

Learning outcomes: L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Inference for Quantitative Variables in Health Conduct one and two-sample t-tests and construct confidence intervals to analyse health data, such as comparing treatment effects or patient outcomes in clinical studies.

learning_activities.topic:
Inference for Two Categorical Variables in Health

Apply the chi-squared test to two-way tables to analyse associations between categorical health variables, such as smoking status and lung cancer diagnosis, to derive evidence-based conclusions.

Learning outcomes: L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_title: Inference for Two Categorical Variables in Health
learning_activities.topic_description: Inference for Two Categorical Variables in Health Apply the chi-squared test to two-way tables to analyse associations between categorical health variables, such as smoking status and lung cancer diagnosis, to derive evidence-based conclusions.

learning_activities.topic:
Compare Several Means and Regression Inference in Health

Apply ANOVA to compare means of health outcomes, like blood glucose levels across treatment groups, and use regression inference, building on Week 2, to model health risk factors, such as BMI and heart disease, to draw evidence-based conclusions.

Learning outcomes: L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_title: Compare Several Means and Regression Inference in Health
learning_activities.topic_description: Compare Several Means and Regression Inference in Health Apply ANOVA to compare means of health outcomes, like blood glucose levels across treatment groups, and use regression inference, building on Week 2, to model health risk factors, such as BMI and heart disease, to draw evidence-based conclusions.

learning_activities.topic:
Presenting Biostatistical Results in Health

Effectively communicate biostatistical findings from health data analyses, such as clinical trial outcomes or public health interventions, through clear, evidence-based presentations tailored to diverse audiences.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Presenting Biostatistical Results in Health Effectively communicate biostatistical findings from health data analyses, such as clinical trial outcomes or public health interventions, through clear, evidence-based presentations tailored to diverse audiences.

learning_activities.topic:
Course Review for Health Data Analysis

Reflect on and integrate core health data analysis skills, including study designs, statistical inference, and effective presentation of biostatistical findings, to prepare for practical applications in medical and public health research.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Course Review for Health Data Analysis Reflect on and integrate core health data analysis skills, including study designs, statistical inference, and effective presentation of biostatistical findings, to prepare for practical applications in medical and public health research.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 12 To Week 13(20 Oct - 02 Nov)
learning_activities.topic:
Seminar on Assessment 2 Project

Present the Assessment 2 project’s findings, in a group seminar, engaging in Q&A and inter-group discussions to enhance health insights.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Seminar on Assessment 2 Project Present the Assessment 2 project’s findings, in a group seminar, engaging in Q&A and inter-group discussions to enhance health insights.
